localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title:
Ukraine requested an urgent meeting of the UN Security Council to discuss ways to guarantee its security and de-escalate the crisis with Russia. The request comes as President Vladimir Putin of Russia weighs recognizing two breakaway regions of Ukraine.
https://t.co/PrllJklQgr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Colombiaâ€™s top court decriminalized abortion, making it the third major Latin American country to allow access to the procedure. https://t.co/WofTKIG6ph
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: The Kremlin published decrees ordering Russiaâ€™s defense ministry to deploy troops to two Moscow-backed separatist territories in Ukraine.
https://t.co/uUJpxjaWkT
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
In a fiery speech, President Vladimir Putin made the case that Ukraine is by history and makeup an integral part of Russia.
https://t.co/Oz1k7cAOpH
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
After 25 seasons, the beloved PBS childrenâ€™s series â€œArthurâ€ will air its final episodes this week.

Marc Brown, the showâ€™s creator, reflected on its longevity, and why now is the right time to end it. https://t.co/sHGvNlSbKM https://t.co/GAcGv6bG8U
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: #Beijing2022 concluded on Sunday with the closing ceremony. Hereâ€™s the overall medal count. ğŸ¥‡ Look back at this year's Winter Olympic Games. https://t.co/LbgdHe2wEi https://t.co/P4BAr4UG7t
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: The Kremlin said Russia would recognize two regions in Ukraine held by Moscow-backed separatists in the near future, escalating tensions in what Western nations fear could lead to one of the biggest conflicts in Europe since World War II.
https://t.co/7uEHic269h
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Bernie Madoffâ€™s sister, Sondra Wiener, and her husband were found dead on Thursday in their home in Florida, in what the authorities said was an apparent murder-suicide. https://t.co/iXXP5J8rUA
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A black bear known as Hank the Tank has broken into more than two dozen California homes since July, officials say. Paintballs, bean bags, sirens and Tasers cannot keep the 500-pound animal from seeking leftover pizza and other food. https://t.co/um5y7p2B1L https://t.co/ZlmmzqUVtB
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Have you ever wondered how a book becomes a book? From vats of ink to 800-pound rolls of paper, we went behind the scenes to reveal how exactly a book is made. https://t.co/ktGYEgB3YK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: U.S. intelligence learned last week that Russia had given the order to proceed with an invasion of Ukraine, prompting President Bidenâ€™s dire warning on Friday. https://t.co/aNclvkRo76
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The U.S. said it had â€œcredible informationâ€ that Russia had compiled a list of Ukrainians to kill or detain in the aftermath of an invasion. https://t.co/M7Jnvu9hbx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: With the threat of war looming, Ukrainians held a memorial in Kyivâ€™s central square to honor dozens of protestors that were killed in the capital eight years ago. @MarcSantoraNYT documented the scene, struck by how calm the city is. https://t.co/8dEsp2OThY
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
â€œThis is a bear that has lost all fear of people.â€

Since the summer, a black bear known as Hank the Tank has broken into over two dozen California homes. Residents have called the police about him more than 100 times. Now the authorities are after Hank. https://t.co/rX0qfMMBfe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: President Biden has agreed â€œin principleâ€ to a French proposal to meet with Vladimir Putin, as long as Russia does not invade Ukraine. https://t.co/be0aiTCYf1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: As the Ukraine crisis continues, Western officials are alarmed by a pact between China and Russia. The Biden administration plans to build up coalitions to counter the potentially world order-changing partnership, portending a new type of Cold War. https://t.co/YJHWwOC7An
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: At Billie Eilishâ€™s arena show in New York City for her latest album "Happier Than Ever," 20,000 frenzied fans screaming along to her every word proved that thereâ€™s no such thing as a quiet Billie Eilish song. https://t.co/1fHoIhFSXo
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: #Beijing2022 was a joyless spectacle: constricted by the pandemic, fraught with geopolitical tensions, tainted by doping accusations and overshadowed by the Ukraine crisis. The Games were a success only as measured by the low bar of avoiding disaster. https://t.co/v3KYZRuCZV
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Doctors are more likely to describe Black patients as uncooperative, new studies have found. Such labels, warned one expert, can turn into a "convenient shortcut" that leads some physicians to blame the patient for their illnesses. https://t.co/XWNFdVkFrn https://t.co/5CTjKIMI08
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: About 10% to 30% of people infected with the coronavirus may develop long-term symptoms, studies estimate. And four factors appear to increase the risk. Here's what we know about how long Covid takes inside the body â€” and why it can be so debilitating. https://t.co/lt8Ycv8xYQ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: President Biden stepped up his warnings about Moscowâ€™s plans last week after seeing evidence that an attack on Ukraine was imminent. https://t.co/RLMWcuTUnn https://t.co/jJpKuTbR8W
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Flight attendants have described passengers hitting them, kicking seats and throwing trash at them. One man dumped a diaper filled with poop in the beverage cart, ending service for the rest of the flight. https://t.co/VzFnaTjwBr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The news of Queen Elizabeth IIâ€™s Covid diagnosis comes at an awkward time for Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who was expected to announce this week the lifting of the last virus restrictions in England, including the need to isolate after a positive test. https://t.co/pOSF1KI9rc
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: This is how you make the best scrambled eggs. https://t.co/zgNQGSK0z4 https://t.co/cwsSdXD9h5
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Aleksandr Lukashenko of Belarus once skillfully managed Moscow, but now he is doing the Kremlinâ€™s bidding in Russiaâ€™s confrontation with Ukraine. https://t.co/S4K4Rf1WgL
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Queen Elizabeth II has been infected with the coronavirus, Buckingham Palace said. It issued few details about the condition of the queen, who turns 96 in April. https://t.co/eX09KdSvwD
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Watching 15-year-old Kamila Valieva and her 17-year-old teammates suffer on TV after the free skate on Thursday has prompted some to ask if raising the minimum competition age at the Olympics would help protect young athletes from abuse and humiliation. https://t.co/D0UbxqZ6Ko
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The people who marched and organized during the civil rights movement are now in their 70s and 80s. Historians are rushing to record their stories. https://t.co/zwi2PpJXbO https://t.co/LFZJ4ldz0Q
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Elana Meyers Taylor of the U.S. became the most decorated Black athlete in Winter Olympics history on Saturday by winning the bronze medal in the two-woman bobsled event at #Beijing2022. https://t.co/sdQ6kPRqgT https://t.co/jAa4KZbPZz
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Winning gold in #Beijing2022 was vindication for Sui Wenjing and Han Cong of China: They had victory within their grasp at the 2018 Games, but lost the gold by 0.43 points.

This time, they set world records for their short program score and total score. https://t.co/2RhWZbopQ6 https://t.co/qu47v71lf7
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: In a blunt show of Russiaâ€™s capabilities, President Vladimir Putin held a test of its nuclear readiness that included launching three missiles. https://t.co/7CFJeBjun4
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Tennessee's new political maps approved by Republicans dismembered Nashvilleâ€™s solidly blue House district â€” held by a Democrat for 147 years â€” and scattered its remains among three new districts that stretch deep into Republican rural areas. https://t.co/22YcAlzsIt
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The Omicron wave is slowing, but the number of people who have died during it has surpassed the number from the Delta wave â€” and it's still increasing in much of the U.S. Since Nov. 24, the country has confirmed more than 154,750 new deaths. https://t.co/XWqvAXIxTE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Jean-Luc Brunel, a former French modeling agent who had been charged with the rape of minors and was suspected of scouting young women for Jeffrey Epstein, was found dead in his Paris jail cell, officials said on Saturday, in what appeared to be a suicide. https://t.co/718jhSHflr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
About 10% to 30% of people infected with the coronavirus may develop long-term symptoms, studies estimate. And four factors appear to increase the risk.

Here's what we know about how long Covid takes inside the body â€” and why it can be so debilitating. https://t.co/5ZHYg9604w

nodes.title: Breaking News: The police arrested demonstrators at gunpoint near the Parliament building in Ottawa in an effort to end the weekslong protests. https://t.co/vDeUauVZFh
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Exclusive: Who's behind QAnon?

Computer scientists say they have identified two men as its likely authors â€” including one of the first online commentators to call attention to the messages that shaped the viral movement. https://t.co/ScyDqbbNAu https://t.co/nLOjpFA9Uu
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Ottawa police moved in to arrest protesters on Friday, with at least 15 people arrested as of midday. Tow trucks whose license plates had been removed and company names covered with Ottawa police stickers were beginning to tow protestersâ€™ trucks away. https://t.co/hAu4zRQPVQ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: During the Berlin airlift of 1948, Lt. Gail Halvorsen helped drop 23 tons of candies, chocolate and chewing gum wrapped in tiny parachutes to the children of West Berlin. He became known as the â€œCandy Bomber.â€ He died this week at 101. https://t.co/ykfKFmSXQl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Hundreds of police moved in to arrest protesters in Ottawa on Friday, hoping to end weeks of gridlock. Anticipation grew as demonstrators heard reports of police cruisers amassing nearby. â€œTheyâ€™re going to corral us,â€ one man said.

Read the latest. https://t.co/Hi2cgG2eB6 https://t.co/ym28EAY89u
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A Marine Corps reservist who was charged with entering the U.S. Capitol during the Jan. 6 riot is now accused of conspiring with a nurse to steal, forge and distribute hundreds of fake Covid vaccination cards, prosecutors said.
https://t.co/jc9Qq1tjcZ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Kim Potter, the ex-police officer who killed Daunte Wright, saying she mistook her gun for a Taser, was sentenced to two years for manslaughter, far less than the standard sentence of about seven years. https://t.co/FrIgo5Fb4r
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The U.S. said Russia had likely amassed as many as 190,000 troops near Ukraineâ€™s borders, significantly raising its estimate of the buildup. It is â€œthe most significant military mobilization in Europe since the Second World War,â€ officials said. https://t.co/8hnxduxJmQ

nodes.title: Markus Dohle, the chief executive of Penguin Random House, will personally donate at least $500,000 to the free-speech organization PEN America in an effort to combat book banning in the U.S., PEN announced on Wednesday. https://t.co/H2IfCsKY1m
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:

https://t.co/tSsMhlim89

The 16-year-old moved into first place.
https://t.co/ewDkTvz1BC

nodes.title: An artillery strike damaged a kindergarten and wounded three adult civilians in east Ukraine, the Ukrainian military said. It blamed â€œoccupationâ€ forces, suggesting the strike was by Russia-backed separatist troops who have long operated in the region. https://t.co/fANFSrluOf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: An anime convention held in Manhattan last November was not a superspreader event, a new CDC study found. Good air filtration, widespread vaccination and masks indoors prevented the 53,000-person event from causing a major Covid outbreak, the agency said. https://t.co/IT2ZIZVXgk
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: An Omicron subvariant that scientists believe is even more contagious is on the rise, the WHO said. It has become dominant in several Asian countries, but a decline in coronavirus testing is muddling the global picture. https://t.co/2UXsrBT3m1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Spotify lured Joe Rogan with a $200 million deal, double initial reports. It made the company a podcasting giant. But controversy followed, putting the company at the center of a fiery debate about misinformation and free speech. https://t.co/gOsaKRKYmr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Kamila Valieva, the Russian figure skating star who is at the center of doping questions at #Beijing2022, was expected to win the womenâ€™s individual event.

But after stumbling and falling during her routine, she finished fourth.
https://t.co/5IMXWueiQC https://t.co/zkuwC9gFoE

nodes.title: A 13-year-old girl was held in a juvenile-detention center for 11 days after a classmate impersonated her on social media to make threats against their school. Now, her family has filed a lawsuit against the school and Instagram for failing to protect her. https://t.co/RwxMVSpfwO
nodes.author: The New York Times

Harvard obtained her therapy notes and gave them to the professor, according to a lawsuit.
https://t.co/X58Uo6dx3v

https://t.co/Q9nhHL0U5a

nodes.title: A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new transplant method involving umbilical cord blood that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/kuGXmL94oZ https://t.co/IeYO4grOIB

nodes.title: Dennis Hope has spent 27 years alone in a Texas prison cell smaller than a compact parking space. nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Novak Djokovic is prepared to miss the French Open, Wimbledon and other tennis tournaments if a Covid vaccine is required to compete, he said in a BBC interview. Being free to choose what goes in his body is â€œmore important than any title,â€ he said. https://t.co/QjkmSbO0yx

nodes.title: Artists who live in New York state and can demonstrate financial need are being invited to apply for $1,000 a month for 18 months, no strings attached, to make it easier to spend time on creative work. https://t.co/qbpsmgO3eE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A 35-year-old woman was killed in her Manhattan apartment by a man who followed her into her building, the police said. Identified as Christina Yuna Lee, she was the latest person of Asian descent injured or killed in a string of attacks in New York City. https://t.co/S3PK7rEyHx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: During the Super Bowl halftime show, Eminem took a knee and held his head after performing "Lose Yourself." An NFL spokesman said the league was aware that he was planning to kneel. https://t.co/lfYYWoqjMI https://t.co/CPwt7TNBi6
nodes.author: The New York Times
